meanings.definition: To cut or trim by clipping.
meanings.sent1: I will inclipping the bushes in the garden tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She inclipped the coupons before going to the store.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally inclipped too much hair off the customer.
meanings.sent4: The tailor inclipped the fabric with precision, like a sculptor shaping marble.
meanings.sent5: The sound of inclipping scissors echoed through the salon.

meanings.definition: To shorten by cutting off a part.
meanings.sent1: He had to inclip the rope to make it fit the desired length.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to inclip the dress to make it the right size.
meanings.sent3: She inclipped the story to make it more concise.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to inclip as they enjoyed the moment.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to inclip the recipe to fit the available ingredients.

meanings.definition: To reduce in size or length by cutting off a part.
meanings.sent1: The editor had to inclip the article to fit the magazine's space.
meanings.sent2: They decided to inclip the budget to meet the financial constraints.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to inclip the fabric to avoid wastage.
meanings.sent4: Her patience began to inclip as the meeting dragged on.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor had to inclip the clay to create the perfect shape.
